[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: compare_entry_function()] [String comparison bypass] Can an attacker exploit Unicode normalization or case sensitivity issues in module_name and function_name string comparisons to bypass entry function filters? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_entry_function()] [Script payload bypass] Do Script and ModuleBundle payloads completely bypass entry function filters, allowing attackers to execute arbitrary code without filtering? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_entry_function()] [Multisig payload wrapping] Can an attacker wrap malicious entry functions in Multisig payloads with None transaction_payload to bypass filtering? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_entry_function()] [EncryptedPayload executable_ref error handling] If executable_ref() returns an error for EncryptedPayload, does it default to false and allow the transaction through? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_entry_function()] [TransactionExecutableRef::Empty bypass] Can an attacker submit transactions with Empty executable references to bypass all entry function filtering? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_entry_function_module_address()] [Multisig None payload exploit] Does a Multisig transaction with no transaction_payload (None) bypass module address filtering by returning false? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_entry_function_module_address()] [Script payload complete bypass] Can attackers use Script payloads to completely avoid module address filtering and execute arbitrary bytecode? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_multisig_address()] [Non-multisig payload bypass] Can attackers avoid multisig address filtering by using EntryFunction, Script, or ModuleBundle payloads instead? (Low)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_multisig_address()] [TransactionPayload::Payload multisig_address None bypass] Can transactions with V1 payloads where multisig_address is None bypass multisig filtering? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_transaction_authenticator_address()] [Ed25519/MultiEd25519 authenticator bypass] Can single-signature transactions using Ed25519 or MultiEd25519 authenticators bypass all address filtering in authenticators? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_transaction_authenticator_address()] [MultiAgent secondary signer injection] Can an attacker include a filtered address in secondary_signer_addresses without providing valid authentication to trigger filter matches? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_transaction_authenticator_address()] [MultiAgent partial authentication] Does the filter match if the filtered address is in secondary_signer_addresses but the actual secondary_signers list is empty or contains NoAccountAuthenticator? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_transaction_authenticator_address()] [FeePayer address confusion] Can an attacker manipulate the fee_payer_address field to bypass filters while the actual fee_payer_signer uses a different authentication method? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_transaction_authenticator_address()] [FeePayer secondary signer mismatch] Can mismatches between secondary_signer_addresses length and secondary_signers length bypass filtering or cause undefined behavior? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_transaction_authenticator_public_key()] [MultiAgent any() short-circuit] Can an attacker place a valid public key first in the secondary_signers list to match the filter while hiding malicious signers later? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_transaction_authenticator_public_key()] [FeePayer public key enumeration] Does the any() iterator in FeePayer secondary_signers allow excessive computation if thousands of signers are included? (Low)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: compare_script_argument_address()] [Non-address argument bypass] Can an attacker include filtered addresses in script arguments of types other than Address (U8, U64, U128, Bool, Vector) to evade detection? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_script_argument_address()] [EntryFunction and Multisig false return] Do EntryFunction and Multisig payloads completely bypass script argument filtering by returning false? (Low)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_script_argument_address()] [EncryptedPayload script argument error handling] If executable_ref() fails for EncryptedPayload, does the false return allow malicious scripts through? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: matches_script_argument_address()] [Empty executable bypass] Can TransactionExecutableRef::Empty bypass all script argument address filtering? (Low)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: TransactionRule::matches()] [All-matchers AND logic exploit] Can an attacker craft transactions that partially match multiple matchers to bypass rules requiring ALL matchers to match? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: TransactionRule::matches()] [Empty matcher list] What happens if a TransactionRule contains an empty Vec of matchers - does it match all transactions or none? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: allows_transaction()] [Rule evaluation short-circuit] Can an attacker exploit the first-match-wins behavior to craft rules that short-circuit evaluation before critical security checks? (High)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/transaction_filter.rs] [Function: filter_transactions()] [Inconsistent filtering] Can race conditions between allows_transaction() calls for different transactions in the same batch lead to inconsistent filtering decisions? (Medium)

[File: crates/aptos-transaction-filters/src/batch_transaction_filter.rs] [Function: allows_transaction()] [Batch context bypass] Can an attacker craft transactions that pass individual filtering but exploit batch-level context (batch_id, author, digest) to bypass security controls? (High)
